inclusion.criterion: A diagnosis of chronic hypertension by at least one of these criteria including
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: hypertension that has persisted beyond the postpartum time frame of a prior pregnancy,
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: hypertension diagnosed and managed before current pregnancy, or elevated blood pressure (systolic blood pressure > or = 140 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure > or = 90 mmHg) prior to 20 weeks gestation requiring medication management
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Taking medication for control of chronic hypertension prior to study entry
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Potential subjects taking medications for control of cardiac arrythmia that fall into the anti-hypertensive class will be considered for this cohort
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Potential subjects for the control cohort: At least 18 years of age
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Absence of a diagnosis of chronic hypertension
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Not taking medication for control of chronic hypertension or arrythmia
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Pregnancy complicated by significant fetal chromosomal anomaly, severe or multiple fetal anomalies, early onset amniotic fluid abnormalities, preterm labor, placental abruption, or IUGR
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Inability to complete the informed consent process or participate in the study
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 79 yo F with multifactorial chronic hypoxemia and dyspnea thought due to diastolic CHF, pulmonary hypertension thought secondary to a chronic ASD and COPD on 5L home oxygen admitted with complaints of worsening shortness of breath. Cardiology consult recommended a right heart cath for evaluation of response to sildenafil but the patient refused.
